learning_modules.module_title: Foundations of Programming and Backend Setup

steps.title: Understanding Variables and Data Types
steps.description: Learn the fundamentals of programming by exploring how to declare variables and understand the different data types they can hold. This is the first building block for writing any software.

steps.title: Basic Program Input and Output
steps.description: Master the core concept of handling data flow in an application. Using 'cin' and 'cout' as a model, you will learn how programs receive input and display output, a universal concept in software development.

steps.title: Building Your First Server with MGS_Express_Framework
steps.description: Transition from general programming concepts to backend development by setting up a basic web server using the MGS_Express_Framework. You will learn to create routes and handle HTTP requests.

steps.title: Managing Application Secrets with Environment Variables
steps.description: Learn the critical practice of separating configuration and secrets from your codebase. This step covers how to use environment variables to manage sensitive data like API keys and database credentials securely.

steps.title: Introduction to HTTP Authentication Concepts
steps.description: Explore the theoretical foundations of web authentication. This step covers different strategies like Basic, Bearer, and OAuth to understand how servers verify a client's identity over the stateless HTTP protocol.

steps.title: Securely Storing User Passwords with Hashing and Salting
steps.description: Implement a fundamental security measure for any application with user accounts. Learn to use cryptographic hashing and salting techniques to protect user passwords in your database, preventing them from being exposed in plain text.

steps.title: Implementing Stateless Authentication with JWT
steps.description: Build a modern, stateless authentication system using JSON Web Tokens (JWT). This step covers the entire JWT lifecycle: generating tokens upon successful login, sending them to the client, and validating them on subsequent API requests.

steps.title: Protecting API Endpoints using Express Middleware
steps.description: Apply your knowledge of JWT validation to protect specific API routes. You will learn to write and use middleware functions in the MGS_Express_Framework to ensure that only authenticated users can access certain endpoints.

steps.title: Defining User Permissions with Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
steps.description: Go beyond authentication to implement authorization. Learn to design and build a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system to manage what authenticated users are allowed to do, such as distinguishing between 'admin' and 'user' privileges.

steps.title: Secure Error Handling for Authentication and Authorization
steps.description: Refine your security implementation by learning to handle errors gracefully and securely. This step focuses on providing meaningful error responses without leaking potentially sensitive information about your system's security mechanisms.
